normalised: the national institute of plant health management (N I P H M) in hyderabad, does a commendable job educating farmers on the safe and effective use of pesticides. they often hold workshops, especially around crucial times like the monsoon season and before the rabi crop sowing which usually starts around fifteenth october. they advocate for integrated pest management (I P M) strategies, which involve using a combination of methods – biological control, crop rotation, and, yes, pesticides – to manage pests sustainably.
